abstract: Brooklyn District Attorney Kenneth P Thompson hopes to ease borough's backlog of open warrants and eliminate obstacles to finding work or housing for thousands of people, through Begin Again program,  which allows anyone with open arrest warrants for minor offenses to have their record cleared; program reflects broader, nationwide efforts to make changes in criminal justice system, which many feel is discriminatory and abusive.
lead_paragraph: District Attorney Kenneth P. Thompson, through his Begin Again effort, is trying to deal with New York City’s backlog of 1.2 million open warrants for small offenses.

headline.main: Brooklyn Program Erasing Warrants for Low-Level Offenses
headline.print_headline: Prosecutor Tries to Ease a Backlog of Warrants

snippet: District Attorney Kenneth P. Thompson, through his Begin Again effort, is trying to deal with New York City’s backlog of 1.2 million open warrants for small offenses.
